content.rendered:
What is a Graphic Designer?

Graphic designers are technologically skilled by trade and creative at heart. They employ creative design programs to create graphics and images for various media, including packaging, logos, advertisements, and art.

Where does a Graphic Designer work?

  • Marketing companies
  • Tech companies
  • Nonprofit organizations
  • Freelance work

How much does a Graphic Designer make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Graphic Designer is $42,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Graphic Designers?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Graphic design majors
  • Art majors
  • Advertising majors
Search Graphic Designer jobs

Graphic Designer skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Graphic Designers succeed in their work:

  • Creativity
  • Teamwork
  • Knowledge of design softwares

What are some common questions about Graphic Designers?

Q: How do I become a Graphic Designer?

A: Start building your portfolio as soon as you can! Use the projects you’re proud of from internships, jobs, and even school projects to show your body of work. Staying up to date with current trends and networking with other designers is also a great way to start your journey.
